info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 12:46AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Grant and northwestern Hidalgo Counties through 115 AM MDT... At 1245 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Redrock, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Redrock, Lordsburg, Virden, Lordsburg Playa, Gila Lower Box and Shakespeare. This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 17 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
